intro: Asperula maximoviczii f. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved asperula, is a cultivar of the asperula species characterized by its wider, more robust leaves compared to the typical form. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many flowering plants known for their showy blooms. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in early spring, adding ornamental value to gardens. It is typically grown as a ground cover or in containers, thriving in partial shade and well-drained soil. Its foliage is often used in horticultural displays for its dense, lush appearance.
